forecast.time_left_until_outcome_known: About 5–6 months (UFC 316 is likely in Oct/Nov 2025; outcome known on event night).
forecast.status_quo_outcome: No — the most likely outcome is that this exact matchup does not occur at UFC 316.
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: UFC 316 is announced without Walker vs. Murzakanov on the card, or one withdraws, or they fight someone else.
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: UFC officially books Walker vs. Murzakanov at UFC 316, both make it to the cage, and Walker wins by KO/TKO/submission/decision.
forecast.rationale:
Two conditions must both be met for a Yes: (1) Johnny Walker must fight Azamat Murzakanov at UFC 316, and (2) Walker must win. The base rate for any specific pairing happening on a specific numbered card several months out is low due to matchmaking alternatives, timing, injuries, and withdrawals. Even if they are in the same division and a plausible pairing, there are many other top-15 options and cards they could land on. Therefore, the status quo heavily favors No.

Decomposing: P(Yes) = P(the fight is on UFC 316) × P(Walker wins | the fight happens). Given current distance to the event and no confirmed booking information, I estimate roughly 10–15% that this exact fight ends up on UFC 316. Conditional on the fight happening, Walker’s win probability looks near coin-flip but slightly underdog versus Murzakanov’s compact power and durability versus Walker’s length, explosiveness, and volatility; I’d place Walker around 40–45% to win if they fight. Multiplying yields ~4–7% overall.

Why not higher: Most bouts that fans can imagine do not get scheduled on a specific PPV months in advance, and even scheduled bouts frequently change. Also, if booked, Walker may still be a slight underdog stylistically. Why not lower: The matchup is plausible within the division’s rankings and timeline, so there is a non-trivial chance UFC books it for a fall PPV, and Walker has clear win paths (range kicking, opportunistic counters, dynamic offense) if it occurs.

What would move me up: An official UFC announcement of Walker vs. Murzakanov specifically for UFC 316; confirmed healthy camps and successful weigh-ins; market odds shortening toward Walker. What would move me down: Either fighter being booked against someone else around that timeframe, reports of injury/withdrawal, or line movement strongly favoring Murzakanov if the bout is booked.

Research assistant note: No additional information available; forecast relies on divisional context, typical UFC booking cadence, and matchup priors.
